forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Partly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. West northwest wind around 3 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a refreshing chill imbued with the tender promise of a new day. The sky, partly cloaked in veils of cloud, hints at a touch of precipitation, with a slight chance of rain lingering in the forecast—a gentle reminder of the city’s character. At the moment, a faint marine layer hovers, softening the outlines of the skyline, and the distant Golden Gate Bridge remains an elegant specter emerging from the mist.

Throughout the day, as the sun begins to rise higher, expect a gradual shift from the cool embrace of morning to a mildly sunny afternoon. Highs near 54 degrees will gradually yield to cooler temperatures, settling around 52 as the daylight wanes. The slight southern breeze, barely a whisper in the trees, adds a refreshing touch, although the remnants of morning fog may linger in pockets along the water’s edge. Dress in layers to embrace the shifting temperature, perhaps a cozy sweater complemented by a light jacket for those moments when the wind stirs lively. An invigorating stroll along the Embarcadero, a quiet moment in one of the city's many parks, or simply savoring a warm beverage while perched on a patio are perfect choices for today’s subtle blend of weather and charm, inviting you to enjoy the day’s quiet adventures.
